message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CC

This paper deals with measuring the relatedness between text segments, which is a common task in natural language processing. The paper specifically focuses on measuring semantic relatedness between words and texts using a word thesaurus. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also mentions tasks such as text retrieval, classification, and clustering, which are related to information retrieval (cs.IR) and machine learning (cs.LG). The approach presented in the paper is based on measuring semantic relatedness, which is a common topic in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper presents experimental results, which may fall under the category of computational complexity (cs.CC).
